src:
Palmer za RSE: Stranim investicijama do konačnog sporazuma. Značajno je uključiti Srpsku listu u Vladu Kosova

01 Nov 2019, 20:00

Specijalni predstavnik američkog državnog sekretara za Zapadni Balkan Metju Palmer izjavio je za Radio Slobodna Evropa (RSE) da bi nove ekonomske mogućnosti i strane investicije na Kosovu i u Srbiji mogle da "olakšaju postizanje konačnog sporazuma u dijalogu o normalizaciji odnosa".Palmer je rekao da je specijalni izaslanik predsednika SAD za pregovore Kosova i Srbije Ričard Grenel u najboljoj poziciji da to i ostvari."Smatramo da postoje američka i evropska preduzeća koja bi bila spremna da investiraju na Kosovu i u Srbiji, a koja oklevaju da to urade zbog nedostatka sigurnosti. Politička klima je takva da onemogućuje medjunarodne investicije u obe države", rekao je Palmer.Prema njegovim rečima, ideja je da li se mogu naći preduzeća koja su spremna da, pod pravim okolnostima i uz napredak ka postizanju konačnog sporazuma, ulože novac i uspostave direktne strane investicije na Kosovu i u Srbiji, stvarajući nova radna mesta, ekonomske mogućnosti, doprinoseći ekonomskom razvoju, a na osnovu napretka u medjusobnim odnosima Srbije i Kosova."To je ideja i mislim da niko nije u boljoj poziciji od ambasadora Ričarda Grenela da to uradi", rekao je Palmer.Američki zvaničnik je u opširnom intervjuu rekao da bi bilo idealno da paralelno budu i investicije i postizanje sporazuma."Idealno bi bilo da to bude paralelno – sam čin formiranja ekonomskih podsticaja i ekonomskih pokretača koji bi olakšali postizanje sporazuma na političkom polju. Naravno, uz dozu hitnosti, da se brzo pronadju neka od tih preduzeća i komercijalne mogućnosti koje bismo upotrebili kao pokretače ovog političkog procesa", rekao je Palmer koji je danas boravio u Prištini.Palmer: Značajno je uključiti Srpsku listu u Vladu Kosova Izaslanik američkog državnog sekretara za zapadni Balkan i zamenik pomoćnika američkog državnog sekretara Metju Palmer izjavio je da je od suštinskog značaja da se Srpska lista uključi u Vladu Kosova."Srpska lista je partija koja je bila uspostavljena od srpske zajednice da predstavlja njene interese u politici Kosova. Bilo bi od suštinskog značaja za vladu da ih uključi, da radi sa njima, i prihvati njihovu ustavnu ulogu u kosovskoj politici", rekao je on u intervjuu za radio Slobodna Evropa.Na pitanje kako gleda na ostale predstavnike srpske zajednice Palmer je rekao da "postoji prostor da se vlada široko angažuje sa više aktera u ovom procesu".Govoreći o mogućnosti ukidanja takse za robu koja se uvozi iz Srbije i Bosne i Hercegovine i njeno zamenjivanje politikom punog dijaloga Palmer je rekao da bi SAD svakako podržale hitno ukidanje taksi."Mi smo već neko vreme to tražili od naših kosovskih partnera i razočarani smo nespremnošću Kosova da to uradi. Što se tiče reciprociteta, to meni zvuči kao nešto o čemu bi se moglo pregovarati sa Srbijom, tako da se nadam da će vlasti Kosova pronaći put i okvir koji bi ih vratio nastavku dijaloga, da kroz taj proces formulišu izazove koji bi mogli da ograniče mogućnost da gradjani Kosova i Srbije slobodno trguju i posluju", kazao je Palmer.
text:
Palmer for RSE: Foreign investment until final agreement. It is important to include the Serb List in the Government of Kosovo

01 Nov 2019, 20:00

US Secretary of State Special Representative for the Western Balkans Matthew Palmer told Radio Free Europe (RSE) that new economic opportunities and foreign investment in Kosovo and Serbia could "make it easier to reach a final agreement in a normalization dialogue." US Presidential Special Envoy for Kosovo-Serbia Negotiations Richard Grenel in the best position to do so. "We believe that there are American and European companies that would be willing to invest in Kosovo and Serbia, and who hesitate to do so for lack of security. Palmer said, "The idea is whether companies can be found that are ready to invest, under the right circumstances and with the progress towards reaching a final agreement, and establish foreign direct investment." in Kosovo and Serbia, creating new jobs, economic opportunities, contributing economically "This is an idea, and I don't think anyone is better placed to do so than Ambassador Richard Grenel," Palmer said.American official said in an extensive interview that it would be ideal investing and reaching an agreement in parallel. "Ideally, it would be parallel - the very act of forming economic incentives and economic drivers that would facilitate agreement in the political field. Of course, with a sense of urgency, to quickly find some of these businesses and commercial opportunities that we would use as drivers of this political process, "said Palmer, who was in Pristina today. Palmer: It is important to include the Serbian List in the Government of Kosovo Secretary for the Western Balkans and US Deputy Assistant Secretary of State Matthew Palmer said it was essential to include the Serb List in the Kosovo Government. "The Serb List is a party established by the Serb community to represent its interests in Kosovo politics. It would be essential for the government to involve them, work with them, and accept their constitutional role in Kosovo politics, "he said in an interview with Radio Free Europe. Asked how he looks at other representatives of the Serb community, Palmer said that" there is room for the government to engage broadly with more actors in the process. "Talking about the possibility of abolishing the tax on goods imported from Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina and replacing it with a full dialogue policy, Palmer said the US would certainly support the urgent abolition of fees." We have been asking our Kosovo partners for some time now and we are disappointed with Kosovo's unwillingness to do so. As far as reciprocity is concerned, this sounds to me like something that could be negotiated with Serbia, so I hope that the Kosovo authorities will find a way and a framework that would return them to the continuation of dialogue, formulate challenges through this process that could limit the possibility that the citizens of Kosovo and Serbia are free to trade and do business, "Palmer said.
